panels.description: The amount of rewards issued to bakers and validators each payday. This is updated once per payday.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  paydays.pool_reward::DECIMAL/1000000 as validator_rewards,
  paydays.finalizer_reward::DECIMAL/1000000 as finalizer_rewards,
  $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
FROM paydays
JOIN blocks on blocks.id = paydays.block;

panels.title: Rewards

panels.description: Comulative amount of rewards given to validators in the given period.

targets.rawSql:
WITH data AS (
  SELECT
    paydays.pool_reward::DECIMAL/1000000 as validator_rewards,
    paydays.finalizer_reward::DECIMAL/1000000 as finalizer_rewards,
    $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
  FROM paydays
  JOIN blocks on blocks.id = paydays.block
  WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(blocks.timestamp)
)

SELECT
  SUM(validator_rewards) OVER (ORDER BY time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS validator_rewards,
  SUM(finalizer_rewards) OVER (ORDER BY time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS finalizer_rewards,
  time
FROM data;

panels.title: Rewards (cumulative)

panels.description: The amount of CCD paid as foundation tax (from transaction fees) to the foundation reward account.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  paydays.foundation_reward::DECIMAL/1000000 as foundation_charge,
  $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
FROM paydays
JOIN blocks on blocks.id = paydays.block;

panels.title: Foundation tax

panels.description: The total amount of foundation tax paid. This is updated once per payday.

targets.rawSql:
WITH data AS (
  SELECT
    paydays.foundation_reward::DECIMAL/1000000 as foundation_charge,
    $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
  FROM paydays
  JOIN blocks on blocks.id = paydays.block
)

SELECT
  SUM(foundation_charge) OVER (ORDER BY time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS foundation_charge,
  time
FROM data;

panels.title: Foundation tax (cumulative)

panels.description: The total amount of minted CCD since genesis. This is updated once per payday.

targets.rawSql:
WITH data AS (
  SELECT
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY blocks.id) id,
    paydays.total_ccd,
    $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
  FROM paydays
  JOIN blocks ON blocks.id = paydays.block
)

SELECT
  (curr.total_ccd - prev.total_ccd)::DECIMAL/1000000 AS minted,
  curr.time
FROM data curr
JOIN data prev ON prev.id + 1 = curr.id;

panels.title: Minted CCDs

panels.description: The number of staked CCD, split into different types of staking.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  paydays.total_equity_capital::DECIMAL/1000000 AS validator_equity,
  paydays.total_actively_delegated::DECIMAL/1000000 AS delegated_to_pool,
  paydays.total_passively_delegated::DECIMAL/1000000 AS passively_delegated,
  $__unixEpochGroup(timestamp, $__interval) AS time
FROM blocks
JOIN paydays ON paydays.block = blocks.id;

panels.title: Staked CCDs

panels.description: The number of accounts that are staking. This is updated once per payday.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  paydays.num_pools as staking_pools,
  paydays.num_delegators as delegators,
  $__unixEpochGroup(timestamp, $__interval) AS time
FROM paydays
JOIN blocks ON blocks.id = paydays.block;

panels.title: Number of accounts staking

panels.description: Note: this counts all registered pools, not only pools that participated in a reward period, so the total may be slightly inconsistent with the "Active staking accounts" graph.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  paydays.num_open_pools as open_for_new,
  paydays.num_closed_for_new_pools as closed_for_new,
  paydays.num_closed_pools as closed,
  $__unixEpochGroup(timestamp, $__interval) AS time
FROM paydays
JOIN blocks ON blocks.id = paydays.block;

panels.title: Staking pool status

panels.description: The number of pools that have delegators. This is updated once per payday.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  paydays.num_delegation_recipients as count,
  $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
FROM paydays
JOIN blocks ON blocks.id = paydays.block;

panels.title: Delegation recipients

panels.description: The number of validators that are also finalizers overlaid on top of the total number of validators. This is captured once per payday.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  paydays.num_finalizers as number_of_finalizers,
  paydays.num_pools as total_staking_pools,
  $__unixEpochGroup(timestamp, $__interval) AS time
FROM paydays
JOIN blocks ON blocks.id = paydays.block;

panels.title: Number of finalizers as a proportion of validators

targets.rawSql:
WITH data AS (
  SELECT 
    COUNT(1) as count,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN is_initial=true THEN 1 END) AS initial_count,
    $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
  FROM accounts
  JOIN blocks
  ON accounts.block=blocks.id
  GROUP BY $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval)
)

SELECT
  data.time,
  SUM(data.count) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS total,
  SUM(data.initial_count) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) AS initial
FROM data;

panels.description: The total number of smart contract instances.

targets.rawSql:
WITH data AS (
  SELECT 
    COUNT(1) AS contracts_count,
    contracts.version as version,
    $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
  FROM blocks
  JOIN contracts
  ON blocks.id=contracts.block
  GROUP BY contracts.version, $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval)
)

SELECT
  data.time,
  SUM(data.contracts_count) FILTER (WHERE data.version = 0) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as contracts_v0,
  SUM(data.contracts_count) FILTER (WHERE data.version = 1) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as contracts_v1
FROM data;

panels.title: Smart contracts (instances)

panels.description:
The number of accounts that have CCD transactions in the selected period.

The CCD transactions are transfers of CCD, which includes transfers (with or without memo), scheduled transfers (with or without memo) and encrypted transfers (with or without memo).

targets.rawSql:
-- We join the accounts, transactions, and blocks table to get the earliest transaction timestamp for each account.
WITH data as (
  SELECT
    MIN($__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval)) AS time
  FROM accounts
  JOIN accounts_transactions ON accounts_transactions.account = accounts.id
  JOIN transactions ON transactions.id = accounts_transactions.transaction
  JOIN blocks ON blocks.id = transactions.block
  WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(blocks.timestamp) AND is_ccd_transfer(transactions.type)
  GROUP BY accounts.id
)

SELECT
  COUNT(1) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as total,
  time
FROM data;

panels.title: Accounts with CCD transactions

panels.description: The total number of smart contract modules since genesis.

targets.rawSql:
WITH data AS (
  SELECT 
    COUNT(1) AS modules_count,
    $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
  FROM blocks
  JOIN modules
  ON blocks.id=modules.block
  GROUP BY $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval)
)

SELECT
  data.time,
  SUM(data.modules_count) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as modules
FROM data;

panels.title: Smart contracts (modules)

panels.description: The amount of transaction fees, in CCD, paid in the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
WITH data AS (
  SELECT 
    SUM(t.cost)::DECIMAL/1000000 AS fees,
    $__unixEpochGroup(b.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
  FROM transactions AS t
  JOIN blocks AS b
  ON t.block=b.id
  WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(b.timestamp)
  GROUP BY $__unixEpochGroup(b.timestamp, $__interval)
)

SELECT
  time,
  SUM(fees) OVER (ORDER BY time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as cumulative_fees 
FROM data;

panels.title: Transaction fees (cumulative)

panels.description: The number of transactions, comulative in the period selected.

targets.rawSql:
WITH data AS (
  SELECT 
    COUNT(1) as count,
    transactions.type as type,
    transactions.is_success as is_success,
    $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
  FROM transactions
  JOIN blocks
  ON transactions.block=blocks.id
  WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(blocks.timestamp)
  GROUP BY $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval), transactions.type, transactions.is_success
)

SELECT
  data.time,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 0 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as deploy_module,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 1 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as init_contract,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 2 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as update,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 3 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as transfer,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 9 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as update_credential_keys,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 10 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as encrypted_amount_transfer,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 11 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as transfer_to_encrypted,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 12 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as transfer_to_public,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 13 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as transfer_with_schedule,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 14 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as update_credentials,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 15 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as register_data,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 16 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as transfer_with_memo,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 17 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as encrypted_amount_transfer_with_memo,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 18 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as transfer_with_schedule_and_memo,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type IN (4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 19) AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as configure_baker,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = 20 AND data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as configure_delegation,
  SUM(data.count) FILTER (WHERE data.type = NULL OR NOT data.is_success) OVER (ORDER BY data.time ASC ROWS BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING AND CURRENT ROW) as rejected
FROM data;

panels.title: Transactions (cumulative)

panels.description: Transaction fees. Note that there is some aggregation in this. Each data point is at least an hour worth of blocks.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
  SUM(t.cost)::DECIMAL/1000000 AS fees,
  $__unixEpochGroup(b.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
FROM transactions AS t
JOIN blocks AS b
ON t.block=b.id
WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(b.timestamp)
GROUP BY $__unixEpochGroup(b.timestamp, $__interval);

panels.title: Transaction fees

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 0 AND transactions.is_success) as deploy_module,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 1 AND transactions.is_success) as init_contract,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 2 AND transactions.is_success) as update,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 3 AND transactions.is_success) as transfer,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 9 AND transactions.is_success) as update_credential_keys,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 10 AND transactions.is_success) as encrypted_amount_transfer,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 11 AND transactions.is_success) as transfer_to_encrypted,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 12 AND transactions.is_success) as transfer_to_public,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 13 AND transactions.is_success) as transfer_with_schedule,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 14 AND transactions.is_success) as update_credentials,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 15 AND transactions.is_success) as register_data,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 16 AND transactions.is_success) as transfer_with_memo,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 17 AND transactions.is_success) as encrypted_amount_transfer_with_memo,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 18 AND transactions.is_success) as transfer_with_schedule_and_memo,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type IN (4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 19) AND transactions.is_success) as configure_baker,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = 20 AND transactions.is_success) as configure_delegation,
  COUNT(1) FILTER (WHERE transactions.type = NULL OR NOT transactions.is_success) as rejected,
  $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval) AS time
  FROM transactions
  JOIN blocks
  ON transactions.block=blocks.id
  WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(blocks.timestamp)
  GROUP BY $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, $__interval);

-- Construct a table of dates filtered by graph scope
WITH dates AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (time)
    -- bigint is important here to make use of the account_activeness_time index, as otherwise the underlying type of time is double precision, which in turn makes the query use sequential scan which is 3x slower per loop.
    $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp,'1d')::bigint as time
  FROM blocks
  WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(blocks.timestamp)
  ORDER BY $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, '1d')::bigint
)

SELECT 
  (
    SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT account)
    FROM account_activeness
    WHERE time BETWEEN (d.time - 86400 * $active_period) AND d.time
  ) as active_accounts,
  time
FROM dates as d;

panels.description: The number of smart contract instances that have had activity in the specified Active period.

targets.rawSql:
-- Construct a table of dates filtered by graph scope
WITH dates AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT ON (time)
    -- bigint is important here to make use of the account_activeness_time index, as otherwise the underlying type of time is double precision, which in turn makes the query use sequential scan which is 3x slower per loop.
    $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp,'1d')::bigint as time
  FROM blocks
  WHERE $__unixEpochFilter(blocks.timestamp)
  ORDER BY $__unixEpochGroup(blocks.timestamp, '1d')::bigint
)

SELECT 
  (
    SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT contract)
    FROM contract_activeness
    WHERE time BETWEEN (d.time - 86400 * $active_period) AND d.time
  ) as active_contracts,
  time
FROM dates as d;

panels.title: Active smart contracts (historical)

list.description: If an account/contract has been affected by a transaction within this period, it is deemed active
list.label: Active period
list.name: active_period
